intro: Sonerila kanjilasseriensis, commonly known as the Kaniyambadi Sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a smooth texture, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
